alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 25 at 9:29AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Maggie Creek Near Carlin affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Maggie Creek...including Carlin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Maggie Creek Near Carlin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, Monitoring stage occurs. No flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 4.6 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 4.5 feet. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 1245 PM PDT.
